Text saved: The two men looked to the north of the land, which was very big. They could hardly see the fences from where they stood. Even if a teenage boy was bored and wanted to get away, he could not escape by walking. Sam looked at the biggest horse, which was kicking the ground with its heavy feet. He wondered if the boy could ride a horse, because a good horse rider might get into a lot of trouble in this place, far from other people. But maybe there was even more trouble for someone who knew nothing about horses and wanted to get away from his father.

Text saved: The two men looked towards the northern end of the property, which stretched as far as the eye could see. From where they stood, even the fences were hardly visible. However bored and rebellious a teenage boy might get, it was not possible to escape on foot. Sam looked at the biggest of the horses, which was kicking the ground with its heavy hooves. He wondered if the boy could ride, because a good rider could get into a lot of trouble out here, miles away from anyone. But maybe there was even more trouble for someone who knew nothing about horses and wanted to get away from his father.

The text flows naturally, using appropriate B1 connectors, and maintains a consistent B1 level throughout. No keywords required definition, and the vocabulary candidates were handled appropriately.
